DOC.brief_title: A Cognitive- Behavioral Play Intervention Siblings Children Diagnosed With Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: Aim 1 : Assess baseline adjustment , cop , pretend play , parent stress , family interaction . - Hypothesis 1a : Children sibling diagnose cancer low level adjustment , cop skill , pretend play compare previous sample norm . - Hypothesis 1b : The child 's adjustment mediate factor related involvement sibling 's medical care , parent 's level communication regard sibling 's illness , frequent isolation family social support , time since sibling 's diagnosis , parent stress . -Hypothesis 1c : Parents child diagnose cancer report high level parent stress compare previous sample norm . Aim 2 : Assess outcome three play intervention session focus increase cop adjustment . - Hypothesis 2a : Compared active control , child play intervention group increase cop skill intervention . - Hypothesis 2b : Compared active control , child play intervention group well psychological adjustment follow intervention . - Hypothesis 2c : Parents child play intervention group report decrease parent stress follow intervention . Once parent consent participate child provide assent , child complete baseline questionnaire measure . Immediately follow completion baseline measure , child randomly assign either play intervention active control group.Children also ask rate mood begin play session . The outcome parent child questionnaire administer session approximately one week third play session , total four play session space approximately one week apart .
